description: Internal surrogate key uniquely identifying this row; used for internal joins and ETL processes.
Audit timestamp for the row's creation or last update, stored as yyyymmddhhmmssmmm; timezone may be local—confirm with SME.
System-generated unique identifier for this invoice record; role relative to keyid unclear—confirm with SME.
Free-text notes or comments associated with the invoice.
Short description or summary of the invoice or charge; may be user-entered.
Vendor-provided invoice number/reference appearing on the supplier’s bill; may contain letters and leading zeros.
Date on the vendor’s invoice (invoice issue date), formatted yyyymmdd.
Flag indicating whether the invoice record is inactive/cancelled and should be excluded from normal processing.
Identifier of the purchase order linked to this invoice, if the invoice is PO-based.
Metadata indicating the referenced entity/table for purchase_order foreign key; used to resolve joins; likely static—confirm with SME.
Identifier of the vendor/supplier who issued the invoice.
Metadata indicating the referenced vendor entity/table for the vendor foreign key; used to resolve joins; confirm with SME.
Original record identifier from the legacy/source system, for cross-system traceability.
Name of the legacy/source table or entity from which this record originated.
Identifier of the source transaction that generated this invoice (e.g., PO, work order); often mirrors purchase_order.
Metadata indicating the referenced entity/table for the source foreign key; used by the application to determine join target; confirm with SME.
